p: Quercetin can be found in plants such as Rubus fruticosus L. and Lagerstroemia speciosa (L.) Pers. [ 46, 47]. Also, quercetin shows antioxidant activity at a concentration of 10 μmol/L in HepG2 cells, inhibiting oxidative stress promoted by H 2O 2 [ 48], promotes an increase in SOD, CAT, and glutathione peroxidase (GPx), and reduces lipid peroxidation in rats with chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome [ 49]. Moreover, quercetin improves sepsis-induced acute lung injury in rats, by reducing lipid peroxidation and inflammation and increasing SOD and CAT levels [ 50].
